cards.name: Celestial Dawn
cards.text:
Lands you control are Plains.

Nonland cards you own that aren't on the battlefield, spells you control, and nonland permanents you control are white.

You may spend white mana as though it were mana of any color. You may spend other mana only as though it were colorless mana.

rulings.text: The effect to turn all your non-land cards (including artifacts) white is the effect of a static ability. Thus, a color change on a permanent prior to Celestial Dawn entering the battlefield will be overridden by Celestial Dawn's effect.
Celestial Dawn does not change the type of lands which are not on the battlefield. Lands not on the battlefield are what they say they are.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype from a land.

You may use a different color mana than the color required for spells and abilities that require a specific color. If you do, and the spell or ability checks the actual color of the mana, it can tell the difference.

If you pay white mana to activate an ability that can only be activated by spending another color of mana, then any limitations on activating the ability (such as the number of times it can be activated each turn) still apply as if you spent the proper color.
Celestial Dawn no longer changes mana symbols on cards.

Mana produced by spells you control and nonland permanents you control isn't affected by Celestial Dawn. Llanowar Elves will produce {G}, for example. However, any colored mana may be spent only on the colorless part of costs.
Land cards you own that aren't on the battlefield aren't changed to Plains.
If you have nonwhite mana in your mana pool when Celestial Dawn enters the battlefield, it remains there but you can spend it only on the colorless part of costs.

"Enters the battlefield" triggered abilities of lands you play won't trigger since the lands will enter the battlefield as Plains. Effects that modify how those lands enter the battlefield, however, will still work. For example, if you play a Dimir Aqueduct, it will enter the battlefield tapped as a Plains, but you won't return a land to your hand.

If you use a text-changing effect such as Mind Bend on Celestial Dawn to change the word "Plains" to a different land type, your lands are all of that new land type, and they will produce mana of the appropriate color for that type.
If a permanent enters the battlefield while Celestial Dawn is on the battlefield, and then Celestial Dawn leaves the battlefield, the permanent's color will revert to the colors in its mana cost.

cards.name: City of Brass
cards.text:
Whenever City of Brass becomes tapped, it deals 1 damage to you.

{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

rulings.text: The first ability triggers no matter how the land becomes tapped.

If you tap City of Brass while you are casting a spell or activating an ability, its ability will trigger and wait. When you finish casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then City of Brass’s triggered ability is put on the stack on top of it. That ability will resolve first.

On the other hand, you can tap City of Brass, put its triggered ability on the stack, and then respond to that ability by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the instant spell or activated ability will resolve first.

cards.name: Deflection
cards.text: Change the target of target spell with a single target.
cards.flavor:
Up and down, 

over and through,

back around—

the joke's on you.

rulings.text: Once the spell resolves, the new target is considered to be targeted by the deflected spell. This will trigger any effects which trigger on being targeted.
This only targets the spell being changed, not the original or new target of the spell it is affecting.
The target of a spell that targets another spell on the stack can be changed to any other spell on the stack, even if the new target will resolve before the spell does.
You can't make a spell which is on the stack target itself.

You can choose to make a spell on the stack target this spell (if such a target choice would be legal had the spell been cast while this spell was on the stack). The new target for the deflected spell is not chosen until this spell resolves. This spell is still on the stack when new targets are selected for the spell.
If there is no other legal target for the spell, this does not change the target.
This does not check if the current target is legal. It just checks if the spell has a single target.
You choose the spell to target on announcement, but you pick the new target for that spell on resolution.
If a spell targets multiple things, you can't target it with Deflection, even if all but one of those targets has become illegal.
If a spell targets the same player or object multiple times, you can't target it with Deflection.

rulings.text: The card is put onto the battlefield, but any effects that check if the original card was "cast from your hand" will not trigger or otherwise consider the card to have been cast from your hand. The card was put onto the battlefield by the effect of Desertion instead.
This spell includes a replacement effect. If the target is an artifact or creature, it never goes to the graveyard.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then this card's ability does not put the card onto the battlefield. The spell continues to resolve as normal.

cards.name: Diminishing Returns
cards.text: Each player shuffles his or her hand and graveyard into his or her library. You exile the top ten cards of your library. Then each player draws up to seven cards.

rulings.text: Each player may choose to draw any number of cards from zero to seven.

First the player whose turn it is chooses how many cards to draw, then each other player in turn order chooses. Then the cards are drawn, first by the player whose turn it is, then by each other player in turn order.

cards.name: Grinning Totem
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice Grinning Totem: Search target opponent's library for a card and exile it. Then that player shuffles his or her library. Until the beginning of your next upkeep, you may play that card. At the beginning of your next upkeep, if you haven't played it, put it into its owner's graveyard.

rulings.text: You may choose to find any kind of card, including a land. You must exile a card (unless the opponent's library is empty); you can't fail to find anything.

"Until the beginning of your next upkeep" means the effect wears off as soon as your next upkeep starts. Your last chance to play the card is usually the End step of the player who immediately precedes you.

The exiled card is played using the normal rules for timing and priority for its card type, as well as any other applicable restrictions. You'll have to pay its mana cost. The only thing that's different is you're casting it from the Exile zone.

rulings.text: First creatures are exchanged, then artifacts are exchanged. It's possible that the same artifact creature may be involved in both exchanges.

cards.name: Lure
cards.text:
Enchant creature

All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.
cards.flavor: When setting a snare, success depends not on the quality of the trap, but the quality of the bait.

rulings.text: Lure does not give a creature the ability to block the Lured creature, it just forces those creatures which are already able to block the Lured creature to do so.
If a Lured creature is in a band, only blockers able to block the Lured creature are affected by the Lure.
The opponent does not have to activate any abilities in an attempt to make his or her creatures block. More specifically, a cost to block of zero mana is an optional cost you can choose not to pay.

cards.name: Mana Prism
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

{1}, {T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Mana Short
cards.text: Tap all lands target player controls and empty his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: Since this is an Instant, your opponent may use Instants in response to the casting of this spell. Note that such spells and abilities will be resolved before the mana pool is emptied by the Mana Short. This makes it useless as a countermeasure for spells. To use it effectively, you need to use it during Upkeep and even then it will not prevent the use of Instant spells and abilities.
If you play Mana Short in response to a spell, it will have no effect on that spell since the mana has already been paid.
It even taps lands that do not produce mana.

cards.name: Manabarbs
cards.text: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

rulings.text: This card has a triggered ability that causes a separate effect for 1 point of damage each time a land is tapped for mana.
This ability is not a mana ability. It goes on the stack and can be responded to.
The ability will trigger each time a land is tapped for mana. Each ability is separate.

If any lands are tapped for mana while a player is casting a spell or activating an ability, Manabarbs's ability will trigger that many times and wait. When the player finishes casting that spell or activating that ability, it's put on the stack, then Manabarbs's triggered abilities are put on the stack on top of it. The Manabarbs abilities will resolve first.

On the other hand, a player can tap lands for mana, let the Manabarbs triggered abilities be put on the stack, and then respond to those abilities by casting an instant or activating an ability using that mana. In that case, the spell or ability will resolve first.

cards.name: Marble Diamond
cards.text:
Marble Diamond enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Maro's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

rulings.text: Creatures are only put into a graveyard for having 0 toughness when state-based actions are checked. If Maro's toughness goes to 0 during the announcement or resolution of a spell or ability and then goes back up above 0 before the end of that announcement or resolution, it won't be put into your graveyard when state-based actions are checked.

cards.name: Meekstone

cards.flavor: When the mighty sleep, the lowly prowl.

cards.name: Memory Lapse
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, put it on top of its owner's library instead of into that player's graveyard.

rulings.text: The card does not go to the graveyard before being put on the library.

This card has a self replacement. This means that it replaces going to the graveyard before any other effect can replace that event. If Flashback is applied, however, Flashback will change the destination.
If the spell is not countered (because the spell it targets can't be countered), then it does not go to its owner's library.

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident

cards.name: Mystic Compass
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Target land becomes the basic land type of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Mystical Tutor
cards.text: Search your library for an instant or sorcery card and reveal that card. Shuffle your library, then put the card on top of it.
cards.flavor:
"To the tutors, a ‘poem of sand' was of little account, a ‘poem of ivory,' priceless."

—Afari, Tales

rulings.text: You do not have to find an Instant or Sorcery card if you do not want to.

cards.name: Nature's Resurgence
cards.text: Each player draws a card for each creature card in his or her graveyard.
cards.flavor:
Spring follows winter

—Elvish expression meaning

"all things pass"

cards.name: Necrosavant
cards.text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: The ability is activated while this card is in the graveyard.

cards.name: Nightmare
cards.text:
Flying

Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.
cards.flavor: As the poisoned land spreads, so does the nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

rulings.text: If you control 0 swamps, then the Nightmare has 0 toughness and will be put into its owner's graveyard as a state-based action right before the next player gains priority.
Nightmare's power and toughness changes as the number of Swamps you control changes.

cards.name: Obsianus Golem
cards.flavor:
"The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ."

—"Song of the Artificer"

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability is countered because the target is illegal.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme

cards.name: Order of the Sacred Torch
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Counter target black spell.
cards.flavor: A blazing light to drive out the shadows.

cards.name: Ornithopter
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"It has been my honor to improve on the Thran's original design. Perhaps history will remember me in some small part for my work."

—Urza, in his apprenticeship

cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature

Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.

cards.name: Painful Memories
cards.text: Look at target opponent's hand and choose a card from it. Put that card on top of that player's library.
cards.flavor:
"It is terrible how one brief action can live forever in memory."

—Jolrael

cards.name: Panther Warriors
cards.flavor: The dogs of war are nothing compared to the cats.

cards.name: Patagia Golem
cards.text: {3}: Patagia Golem gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor: It scattered falcons like a lion hunting among jackals.

cards.name: Pearl Dragon
cards.text:
Flying

{1}{W}: Pearl Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They knew Bantau was lost when, to hide the pearl he had found on the beach, he swallowed it—and soon grew wings."

—Hakim, Loreweaver

cards.name: Pentagram of the Ages
cards.text: {4}, {T}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor: A mirror, a shield, a promise, a great distance, and a kind word—five ways to avoid harm.

cards.name: Perish
cards.text: Destroy all green creatures. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"There will come a time when the voices of soil and seedling will sing only laments."

—Oracle en-Vec

cards.name: Pestilence
cards.text:
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence.

{B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

rulings.text: Each activation is considered a new damage effect. An activation can only be 1 point of damage.
Note that "until end of turn" effects wear off after "at the beginning of the end step" triggered abilities, so an artifact that animates until end of turn can keep this on the battlefield.

It will stay on the battlefield if there is a creature that is put into the graveyard during the end step. This is because this ability will not trigger at all if there is at least one creature on the battlefield as the end step begins.

cards.name: Phantasmal Terrain
cards.text:
Enchant land

As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type.

Enchanted land is the chosen type.

rulings.text: Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.name: Phantom Warrior
cards.text: Phantom Warrior is unblockable.
cards.flavor: The phantom warrior comes from nowhere and returns there just as quickly.

cards.name: Phyrexian Vault
cards.text: {2}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"The secrets of Phyrexia are expensive. You will pay in brass and bone, steel and sinew."

—Kaervek

cards.name: Polymorph
cards.text: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. Its controller reveals cards from the top of his or her library until he or she reveals a creature card. The player puts that card onto the battlefield, then shuffles all other cards revealed this way into his or her library.
cards.flavor: "Ahh Opposable digits"

rulings.text: If there are no creatures in the player's library, then the target creature is still destroyed, you see all the cards in that player's library, and then they shuffle and continue play.
If the targeted creature is an illegal target by the time Polymorph would resolve, the entire spell is countered. Nothing else happens.
If the targeted creature is indestructible, it's still a legal target -- it just isn't destroyed. The rest of Polymorph's effect happens as normal.
If there are no creature cards in the player's library, all the cards in that library are revealed, then the library is shuffled. (The targeted creature remains destroyed.)
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tappped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.name: Pradesh Gypsies
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"A mysterious people indeed. Their origins are as secret as their traditions."

—Lord Magnus of Llanowar

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

rulings.text: In zones other than the battlefield, Primal Clay is 0/0.

If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of Primal Clay, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of Primal Clay, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for Primal Clay when it entered the battlefield.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: {T}: Prodigal Sorcerer deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Occasionally members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

cards.name: Prosperity
cards.text: Each player draws X cards.
cards.flavor:
"Wealth is a good thing, compared to poverty—your food is better, your robes are softer, and your companions have bathed more recently."

—Kukemssa pirate

rulings.text: If both players run out of cards during this effect, the game is a draw.

cards.name: Psychic Transfer
cards.text: If the difference between your life total and target player's life total is 5 or less, exchange life totals with that player.
cards.flavor:
"The memory of your existence will fade like the final stars of morning."

—Kaervek

rulings.text: If one of the players has a negative life total, you use their actual life total for determining the difference. If that difference is five or less, then the other player receives the negative life total.
If an effect says that a player can't lose life, that player can't exchange life totals with a player who has a lower life total; in that case, the exchange won't happen.

cards.name: Psychic Venom
cards.text:
Enchant land

Whenever enchanted land becomes tapped, Psychic Venom deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

rulings.text: Whenever the land is tapped for any reason, the ability triggers.

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor:
"Hiniya Behold the man of flint, that's me / Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return."

—Navajo war chant

rulings.text: You can assign damage to multiple targets and are not forced to assign the same amount of damage to each target.
You can't do fractional points of damage.
The number of targets must be at least 1 and at most 4. You divide the damage as you cast Pyrokinesis, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.

cards.name: Python
cards.flavor:
"How can you claim the gods are merciless when they robbed the snake of its limbs to give the other creatures a sporting chance?"

—Hakim, Loreweaver

cards.name: Radjan Spirit
cards.text: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

rulings.text: Can be used on a creature without Flying with no effect.

cards.name: Rag Man
cards.text: {B}{B}{B}, {T}: Target opponent reveals his or her hand and discards a creature card at random. Activate this ability only during your turn.
cards.flavor: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

cards.name: Raging Goblin
cards.text: Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.)
cards.flavor: He raged at the world, at his family, at his life. But mostly he just raged.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: The earth cannot hold that which magic commands.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact, Enchantment, or Land. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature cards.

cards.name: Rampant Growth
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Rath forces plants from its surface as one presses whey from cheese.

rulings.text: The land does not count toward your one per turn limit because it was put onto the battlefield by an effect.
Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.name: Razortooth Rats
cards.text: Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
cards.flavor:
"Men and rats both hunger: we for our playthings; they, for us."

—Crovax

cards.name: Recall
cards.text: Discard X cards, then return a card from your graveyard to your hand for each card discarded this way. Exile Recall.

rulings.text: You don't discard cards until Recall resolves. If you don't have X cards in your hand at that time, you discard all the cards in your hand.

You don't choose which cards in your graveyard you'll return to your hand until after you discard cards. You choose a card in your graveyard for each card you discarded, then you put all cards chosen this way into your hand at the same time. You may choose to return some or all of the cards you just discarded.

cards.name: Reckless Embermage
cards.text: {1}{R}: Reckless Embermage deals 1 damage to target creature or player and 1 damage to itself.
cards.flavor: Many mages have been consumed by their work.

cards.name: Redwood Treefolk
cards.flavor: The soldiers chopped and chopped, and still the great tree stood, frowning down at them.

cards.name: Regal Unicorn
cards.flavor: Unicorns don't care if you believe in them any more than you care if they believe in you.

cards.name: Regeneration
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

{G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

cards.name: Relearn
cards.text: Return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor:
"Barrin taught me that the hardest lessons to grasp are the ones you've already learned."

—Ertai, wizard adept

cards.name: Relentless Assault
cards.text: Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
cards.flavor:
"Flog and Squee / Up the tree / See the army / Flee, flee, flee."

—Goblin nursery rhyme/war cry

rulings.text: If you manage to cast this during a main phase of your opponent's turn, that opponent's creatures will untap and that opponent will be able to attack again. It will not allow you to attack during their turn.
Abilities that trigger when a creature attacks, blocks, or is blocked will trigger during each combat that turn. Thus, a creature with Rampage will get the bonus added during each attack.
A creature that must attack each turn, must only attack once that turn. It is not forced into each attack that turn.
It only creates an additional combat and main phase if it resolves during a main phase.

cards.name: Remedy
cards.text: Prevent the next 5 damage that would be dealt this turn to any number of target creatures and/or players, divided as you choose.
cards.flavor:
"These things will protect you while I'm gone, remind you of my love for you."

—"Love Song of Night and Day"

rulings.text: You choose the targets and you choose how to divide up the 5 damage on announcement.
You can't choose zero targets. You must choose at least one target.

cards.name: Remove Soul
cards.text: Counter target creature spell.
cards.flavor: Nethya stiffened suddenly, head cocked as if straining to hear some distant sound, then fell lifeless to the ground.

rulings.text: A "creature spell" is any spell with the type Creature, even if it has other types such as Artifact or Enchantment. Older cards of type Summon are also Creature spells.

cards.name: Reprisal
cards.text: Destroy target creature with power 4 or greater. It can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor:
"The meek shall fight as one, and they shall overcome even the greatest of foes."

—Halvor Arenson, Kjeldoran priest

cards.name: Resistance Fighter
cards.text: Sacrifice Resistance Fighter: Prevent all combat damage target creature would deal this turn.
cards.flavor:
"My soldiers fought without hesitation, died without doubt."

—Sidar Jabari

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

cards.name: River Boa
cards.text:
Islandwalk

{G}: Regenerate River Boa.
cards.flavor:
"But no one heard the snake's gentle hiss for peace over the elephant's trumpeting of war."

—Afari, Tales

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor:
"I've dreamt of a second harvest but fear I will not see it."

rulings.text: The first sentence is a continuous ability. You reveal the card when you draw it, during the resolution of any draw effect. The second sentence is a triggered ability, and thus will wait until the entire draw effect finishes resolving before you do it.

cards.name: Ruins of Trokair
cards.text:
Ruins of Trokair enters the battlefield tapped.

{T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

{T}, Sacrifice Ruins of Trokair: Add {W}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor:

cards.name: Sage Owl
cards.text:
Flying

cards.flavor: The owl asks but never answers.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

cards.name: Scaled Wurm
cards.flavor:
"Flourishing during the Ice Age, these wurms were the bane of all Kjeldorans. Their great size and ferocity made them the subject of countless nightmares—they embodied the worst of the Ice Age."

—Kjeldor: Ice Civilization

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor:
"They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,

Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;

It had been strange, even in a dream,

To have seen those dead men rise."

—Samuel Coleridge,

"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Segovian Leviathan

cards.flavor:
"Leviathan, too Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?"

—The Bible, Job 41:1

cards.name: Sengir Autocrat

When Sengir Autocrat enters the battlefield, put three 0/1 black Serf creature tokens onto the battlefield.

When Sengir Autocrat leaves the battlefield, exile all Serf tokens.

rulings.text: When it leaves the battlefield, it exiles all Serf tokens on the battlefield and not just the ones it generated or just the ones under your control.

cards.name: Serenity

cards.flavor:

—Hanna, Weatherlight navigator

cards.name: Shanodin Dryads
cards.text: Forestwalk
cards.flavor: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

cards.name: Shatter
cards.text: Destroy target artifact.

rulings.text: Regenerating artifacts can regenerate from this.

cards.name: Shatterstorm
cards.text: Destroy all artifacts. They can't be regenerated.
cards.flavor: Chains of leaping fire and sizzling lightning laid waste the artificers' handiwork, sparing not a single device.

cards.flavor:
Lightning tethers souls to the world.

Flying

cards.flavor: She had expected death to roar, to thunder, to growl. She did not recognize it when it came hissing to her side.

rulings.text: Your opponent does not have to draw a card if they don't want to.

cards.name: Skull Catapult
cards.text: {1}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skull Catapult deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor:
"What manner of fiend would design such a sadistic device?"

—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

{T}: Add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:

rulings.text: It used to make Cobra tokens. Now it makes Snake tokens.

cards.name: Soldevi Sage
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice two lands: Draw three cards, then discard one of them.
cards.flavor:
"To hide the truth is more than folly—it is fatal." 

—Sorine Relicbane, Soldevi heretic

cards.name: Soul Net
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

rulings.text: If animated so it is a creature, it can be triggered off its own destruction.

cards.name: Spell Blast
cards.text: Counter target spell with converted mana cost X.
cards.flavor: Call it the thinking mage's version of brute force.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)

Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: Damage that is redirected is not dealt to the original creature or player, but it is dealt to the new creature or player.
You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.name: Spitting Drake
cards.text:
Flying

{R}: Spitting Drake gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: It prefers its meals cooked.

cards.flavor:
"There are times solid ground gives precious little comfort."

—Talibah, embermage

cards.name: Stalking Tiger
cards.text: Stalking Tiger can't be blocked by more than one creature.
cards.flavor: In the Jamuraan jungles, there is often no separating beauty from danger.

cards.name: Standing Troops
cards.text: Vigilance
cards.flavor: The less you have, the harder you fight for it.

cards.name: Staunch Defenders
cards.text: When Staunch Defenders enters the battlefield, you gain 4 life.
cards.flavor:
"Hold your position Leave doubt for the dying"

—Tahngarth of the Weatherlight

cards.name: Stone Rain
cards.text: Destroy target land.

cards.name: Storm Cauldron
cards.text:
Each player may play an additional land during each of his or her turns.

Whenever a land is tapped for mana, return it to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If a land is tapped for mana and sacrificed all in one action, it goes to the graveyard before the Cauldron can return it to the player's hand.
If a land is tapped for mana, it is returned to its owner's hand as a triggered ability.
Having multiples of these on the battlefield means you can play an additional land for each one.

cards.name: Storm Crow
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor:
Storm crow descending, winter unending.

Storm crow departing, summer is starting.

cards.name: Strands of Night

cards.flavor:

—Crovax

cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.text: Haste
cards.flavor:
Don't insult a Talruum unless your mount is swift. 

—Suq'Ata saying

cards.name: Tariff
cards.text: Each player sacrifices the creature he or she controls with the highest converted mana cost unless he or she pays that creature's mana cost. If two or more creatures a player controls are tied for highest cost, that player chooses one.

rulings.text: The choice of creatures is made on resolution and not on announcement.
You can use mana abilities during the resolution of this spell if the player decides to pay the mana cost.
You choose whether to pay or not on resolution. If not, then you sacrifice the creature. You can choose to not pay if you control no creatures on resolution.

First the active player identifies the creature he or she controls with the highest mana cost (and chooses one if there’s a tie) and chooses whether to sacrifice it or pay mana. Then each other player in turn order does the same. All creatures sacrificed this way are sacrificed at the same time.
Although Tariff checks the converted mana cost of the creatures on the battlefield, you need to pay the creature’s actual mana cost (including color) to keep it on the battlefield.

cards.name: Teferi's Puzzle Box
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's draw step, that player puts the cards in his or her hand on the bottom of his or her library in any order, then draws that many cards.

rulings.text: You do your normal draw before this ability is put on the stack.
If you have more than one of these, each effect triggers separately.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

cards.name: The Hive
cards.text: {5}, {T}: Put a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp onto the battlefield. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

cards.name: Thicket Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

rulings.text: Protection from Green does not stop the Basilisk's ability because the ability is not targeted.

The ability destroys the creature at the end of the combat, which is after all first strike and normal damage dealing is done. This means that a creature may have to regenerate twice to survive the combat, once from damage and once again at end of combat.

cards.name: Zur's Weirding
cards.text:
Players play with their hands revealed.

If a player would draw a card, he or she reveals it instead. Then any other player may pay 2 life. If a player does, put that card into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player draws a card.

rulings.text: If someone pays the cost, then the card was never drawn or discarded. It just gets put into the graveyard directly from the library.
This is continuous replacement effect that modifies a draw.
If a spell or ability causes more than one card to be drawn, draw the cards one at a time and deal with this replacement before drawing the next card.

When using Dredge with this, you have two choices.  You can immediately replace the draw with Dredge, or you can apply Zur's Weirding's replacement.  If the latter, you first resolve Zur's Weirding's ability, then if you're going to draw the card, decide whether or not to replace that draw with Dredge.
